definition: lit. in the same boat under wind and rain (idiom); fig. to stick together in hard times
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
boat

sentences.english: What Americans do at times of tragedy is to come together and support each other.
sentences.chinese: 風雨同舟，榮辱與共是美國人民面對不幸的傳統美德。

sentences.english: Lovers can undergo difficulties, but part after that.
sentences.chinese: 愛人可以風雨同舟，之後卻天各一方。

sentences.english: Having gone through many years of hardship in the same boat, the old couple have a rather acute sense of the true value of love in their life.
sentences.chinese: 風雨同舟幾十年，這對老夫婦深感人生中愛情的珍貴。

sentences.english: Can not find a person to accompany me to stand together through storm and stress that I walk alone.
sentences.chinese: 找不到可以陪我風雨同舟的人，那我就一個人走。

sentences.english: We look forward with you through storm and stress together to open a new world.
sentences.chinese: 我們期待與您風雨同舟，攜手開創新的天地。

definition: close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
firm/unswerving/loyal to the end
to follow through/to carry through to the end
millions of people all of one mind (idiom); the people united
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
lit. to lift the tray to eyebrow level (idiom); mutual respect in a marriage
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
to struggle arduously
to charge and break through enemy lines
fellow soldier
long-cherished wish
to advance courageously (idiom)/to press forward
unswerving from start to finish (idiom)
